alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:20PM EST until January 10 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Lehigh River At Walnutport affecting Lehigh and Northampton Counties. For the Lehigh River...including Walnutport...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lehigh River at Walnutport. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flooding begins downstream at Catasaqua and Hokendaqua. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 8.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Lehigh River Walnutport 8.0 3.4 Tue 3 pm 6.8 5.4 8.6 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EST.
